summary: We surveyed school districts across the country on testing for lead in drinking water in 2017. Based on our nationally generalizable survey, we estimate that: 41% of districts, serving 12 million students, had not tested for lead in the 12 months before completing our survey. 43% of districts, serving 35 million students, tested for lead. Of those, 37% found elevated levels and reduced or eliminated...
title: K-12 Education: Lead Testing of School Drinking Water Would Benefit from Improved Federal Guidance
